item.title: A new pot hole next to the temporary repair. Wires exposed., 9th January
item.description:
Just before the keep clear markings outside 2 Westfield Road. Was filled in a couple of weeks ago but another large chunk of tarmac next to the infill has come away leaving a deep hole and exposing wires for the traffic lights.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Westfield Road, Brockworth, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unpermitted roadworks problem, 9th January
item.description:
Customer reports that the temporary TS at the location are out of sync with the permanent lights at Parton Road's junction with Cheltenham Road East. Consequently, traffic is backing up - people are becoming impatient and turning around dangerously (this is also on a route for 5 schools). Furthermore, due to alterations to the width of the road at the Cheltenham Road junction (new cycle way) and the introduction of a single lane, vehicles wishing to turn towards Cheltenham are getting stuck and blocking progress, as nobody will let them out who is approaching from the opposite direction - this is exacerbating the situation. Please can this be addressed.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, neighbour saw a man in a white van outside my house and assumed they were collecting something but Iv come home and there is a fridge freezer left out the front of my house she didn’t get the reg. and doorbell footage doesn’t cover that area., 9th January
item.description:
Fridge freezer. I have came home and this has been left out on the path against my fence at the front of my property.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmleaze, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Flytipping (not witnessed and no evidence likely)

item.title: Unpermitted roadworks problem, 9th January
item.description:
Customer complains that 3-way temporary TS have been placed in the location again. However, there's no work being carried out at this time and, given it's the weekend, it's conceivable nothing will be done until at least next week. They ask why the lights can't be put up on the day that work is being started/whilst it is being carried out to prevent any unnecessary traffic build up. The road is chaotic and busy with the lights; they are a cab driver and have to use this road regularly - the cost of queues have to be passed to their customers. Feedback appreciated.
Report on FixMyStreet
